conclusion: Charged sphere with mass m and charge +q moves under gravity and electric field.
Identify known parameters: sphere mass m, charge +q, thread length L, angle θ = 30°, uniform electric field, sphere released from rest at point B.
Objective: Find speed at lowest point C and tension at that point.
At equilibrium position A, forces are gravity mg, tension T, and electric force qE.
For equilibrium at A, horizontal component Tsinθ = qE and vertical component Tcosθ = mg.
Calculate tension T = 2mg/√3 from vertical component.
Calculate electric field strength E = mg/(q√3) from horizontal component.
Apply energy conservation from B to C: mgL - qEL = 1/2mv_C^2.
Substitute E = mg/(q√3) into energy conservation equation.
Calculate tension at point C: T_C = mv_C^2/L + mg.
Final answer: Speed at C is √(2gL(√3-1)/√3), tension at C is mg(3-2/√3).
